title: Detecting Shortcut Learning for Fair Medical AI using Shortcut Testing. (arXiv:2207.10384v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Machine learning (ML) holds great promise for improving healthcare, but it is critical to ensure that its use will not propagate or amplify health disparities. An important step is to characterize the (un)fairness of ML models - their tendency to perform differently across subgroups of the population and to understand its underlying mechanisms. One potential driver of algorithmic unfairness, shortcut learning, arises when ML models base predictions on improper correlations in the training data. However, diagnosing this phenomenon is difficult, especially when sensitive attributes are causally linked with disease. Using multi-task learning, we propose the first method to assess and mitigate shortcut learning as a part of the fairness assessment of clinical ML systems, and demonstrate its application to clinical tasks in radiology and dermatology. translated_abstract: 机器学习对于改善医疗保健具有巨大的潜力，但确保其使用不会传播或加剧健康差异至关重要。重要的一步是表征（不）公平的机器学习模型-它们在人群的子集上执行不同的倾向和理解其潜在机制。算法不公平性的一个潜在驱动因素，即捷径学习，出现在机器学习模型基于训练数据中不适当的相关性进行预测的情况下。然而，诊断此现象是困难的，尤其是当敏感属性与疾病有因果联系时。使用多任务学习，我们提出了第一种方法，作为临床机器学习系统公平性评估的一部分来评估和减轻捷径学习，并展示其在放射学和皮肤科临床任务中的应用。最后，我们的方法揭示了捷径不负责不公平的实例，凸显需要一种全面性方法的需求。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新方法，使用多任务学习来评估和减轻机器学习模型中的捷径学习现象，作为公平性评估的一部分，这种方法能够在临床任务中应用。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new method that uses multi-task learning to assess and mitigate shortcut learning in machine learning models as part of fairness assessment of clinical ML systems, which can be applied in clinical tasks and highlights the need for a holistic approach.
